assumptions.title: Assumptions
items: This planner is for ABLE account savings planning only and does not provide legal, tax, investment, or financial advice.
Results are deterministic projections based entirely on user inputs and configured rules; they are not predictions of actual future performance.
Investment return is modeled as a constant annual rate converted to a constant monthly rate for projection purposes.
Contributions and withdrawals are modeled as recurring monthly cash flows according to user-entered values.
The contribution period ends on the selected Contribution End Date, or earlier if automatic stop rules apply due to plan account balance limits or SSI limits, if applicable.
The withdrawal period begins on the selected Withdrawal Start Date.
Contribution increase percentage and withdrawal increase percentage are applied in annual intervals.
When contribution increases would exceed annual contribution limits, contribution increases are stopped according to planner limit logic.
ABLE to Work, if eligible, is modeled using entered earned income and configured poverty-level constraints to determine additional contribution allowance.
If ABLE to Work is not used or not eligible, baseline annual contribution limits are enforced in planner logic.
Federal Saver's Credit is estimated from taxable income and filing status inputs using most recent Federal Tax brackets and Federal limit rules.
State tax benefit estimates, deduction or credit, are based on current state rules and filing status logic.
Tax benefits are capped by estimated liability where applicable under configured rules.
Taxable-account federal and state tax drag are estimated from configured tax rates and rules and applied in the taxable projection model.
Taxable-account tax drag is shown as a negative impact in comparison outputs.
ABLE and taxable account comparisons assume identical user cash-flow assumptions unless rule-based constraints alter ABLE account behavior.
If SSI eligibility is enabled, the planner applies SSI balance-cap behavior, including stopping contributions and applying required withdrawals as modeled.
If a plan account balance maximum constraint is reached, planner logic stops contributions per configured rules.
If requested withdrawals exceed available funds, withdrawals are limited to available balance and balances are not allowed to go negative.
Projection horizon is limited to the configured maximum allowable years for the selected client or state experience.
Report Window controls filter the displayed reporting range within the full calculated schedule.
Chart display ends at the first month where projected ending balance reaches zero, when applicable.
Certain chart components use smoothing or distribution for visualization readability; detailed month-level schedule values remain the system of record for exact month results.
Currency values are rounded and formatted for display; minor visual differences may occur versus underlying calculation precision.
Outputs depend on selected language and client configuration, including labels, tab availability and order, and presentation behaviors.
State and federal program rules may change over time; this planner reflects only the currently loaded rules and configuration set.
Eligibility and compliance decisions should be confirmed with qualified professionals and official ABLE program guidance before acting.

buttons.changeResidencyProceed: Change my residency and proceed to the calculator
buttons.enterAgiToTestEligibility: Enter Taxable Income to test eligibility
buttons.notEligibleBasedOnAgi: Not eligible based on Taxable Income
buttons.understandProceed: I understand and would like to proceed

inputs.agiCallout:
Taxable income helps determine projected federal and, where applicable, state tax benefits.

Remember that your taxable income is not the same as your salary. It may be more than your earned income due to other sources of income. Conversely, for most taxpayers, it often is less than your earned income due to deductions or exemptions. You can find your taxable income in your most recent tax return if you filed one. If you are not sure what your current taxable income is, simply put your salary and wages.
inputs.annualReturnCallout: This is the assumed annual investment return used in projections. You can change it to explore different scenarios.
inputs.contributionEndCallout: Select the month and year when recurring contributions should stop. If left blank, contributions continue through the selected time horizon. The ABLE planner will stop contributions at an earlier date if certain SSI or plan account balance limits are reached, as applicable.
inputs.contributionIncreaseCallout: Use this to model annual increases in recurring contributions. The planner may limit increases automatically when contribution limits would be exceeded.
inputs.contributionIncreaseDisabledHelper: Base contributions already meet the annual limit; increases are disabled.
inputs.contributionIncreaseBreachHelper: At {{pct}}%, contributions exceed the annual limit in year {{breachYear}}. Contribution increases will stop after year {{stopYear}}.
inputs.filingStatusCallout: Your filing status helps determine projected federal and, where applicable, state tax benefits.
inputs.fscHeadingCallout: The Federal Saver’s Credit is a non-refundable tax credit that may reduce your federal income tax if you make eligible contributions to retirement or ABLE accounts and meet income limits. The credit percentage depends on your Adjusted Gross Income (AGI) and filing status, and it cannot exceed your total federal tax liability.
inputs.fscIntro: Answer these questions to estimate eligibility.
inputs.fscTaxLiability: Do you have federal income tax liability?
inputs.monthlyContributionCallout: Enter the recurring monthly contribution amount. Contributions are modeled as recurring cash flows and may be capped by ABLE plan rules in the projection.
inputs.monthlyWithdrawalCallout: Enter the recurring monthly withdrawal amount.
inputs.nameCallout: The beneficiary is the person who owns the ABLE account and for whom the funds are intended. Contributions, withdrawals, and eligibility rules apply to this individual.
inputs.ssiEligibilityCallout: Supplemental Security Income (SSI) is a needs-based federal program that provides monthly cash assistance to individuals with disabilities and limited income and resources. ABLE account balances up to $100,000 are excluded from the SSI resource limit, but amounts above that threshold may affect eligibility.
inputs.startingBalanceCallout: Starting balance should reflect an existing ABLE account balance and/or qualified rollover amount used to begin this projection.
inputs.stateOfResidenceCallout: Your state of residence is used to determine plan eligibility and certain state tax benefits.
inputs.timeHorizonCallout: Choose how long you want to plan. The selected horizon determines how far projections run and where contribution or withdrawal schedules end.
inputs.withdrawalIncreaseCallout: Use this to model annual increases in recurring withdrawals over time.
inputs.withdrawalStartCallout: Select the month and year when recurring withdrawals should begin. If left blank, withdrawals start at the beginning of the projection. The ABLE planner will implement required withdrawals in an amount necessary to keep the account balances under the SSI limit, if applicable.
inputs.wtaEarnedIncomeQuestion: Does the beneficiary have earned income?
inputs.wtaRetirementPlanQuestion: Is the beneficiary covered by a retirement plan?

schedule.enterTimeHorizonPrompt: Enter a time horizon to view the schedule.

fsc.dependent: Can someone claim you as a dependent?
fsc.intro: Answer these questions to estimate eligibility.
fsc.taxLiability: Do you have federal income tax liability?

labels.highReturnWarning: That return assumption is unusually high. Consider ≤ {{max}}%.
labels.residencyGeneralAdvice: You should check to see if your home state offers an ABLE plan, which may provide certain state tax benefits.
labels.residencyNotAllowed: The beneficiary is not eligible to open a {{plan}} account because the {{plan}} plan requires the beneficiary to be a resident of {{state}}.
labels.wtaEarnedIncomeQuestion: Does the beneficiary have earned income?
labels.wtaRetirementPlanQuestion: Is the beneficiary covered by a retirement plan?

messages.ableDepletionNotice: Based on your assumptions, the ABLE account balance reaches zero in {{reachMonthYear}}. Accordingly, withdrawals are stopped in this planner after {{stopMonthYear}}.
messages.ableDepletionNoticeLimitedWithdrawals: Based on your assumptions, the ABLE account balance reaches zero in {{reachMonthYear}}. After {{reachMonthYear}}, withdrawals are limited each month to the amount available in the account.
messages.balanceCapWarning:
Based on your planned contributions, withdrawals and earnings assumptions the account is projected to exceed {{cap}} in {{breach}}.

This may result in suspension of SSI benefits and have an adverse financial impact.

Accordingly, in this planning tool, contributions are stopped in {{stop}}. Recurring withdrawals are also initiated in {{withdrawStart}} to keep the balance at {{cap}} by withdrawing the projected monthly earnings.
messages.ssiIncomeEligibilityWarning: Based on your taxable income and filing status, you may not be eligible for SSI benefits. However, the ABLE planner will assume the beneficiary is eligible for SSI benefits based on your selection. Accordingly, the ABLE planner will implement logic that will keep the account balances below the SSI limit by stopping contributions and enforcing required distributions, where necessary.
messages.ssiSelectionPlannerMessage: The ABLE Planner will stop contributions and implement withdrawals where necessary to keep your projected account balance under $100,000.
messages.withdrawalLimitedToAvailable: The withdrawal amount you entered exceeds the amount available in your account. Accordingly, the ABLE planner will limit your withdrawals to the amount available in your account.
messages.planMaxReached: In this planning tool, contributions stop in {{month}} because the projected balance reaches the plan maximum of {{cap}}.
messages.workToAblePrompt: Your planned contributions exceed the annual ABLE limit of {{cap}}. If you are working, you may qualify to contribute more (the “ABLE to Work” provision). Would you like to find out if you qualify?
messages.wtaAutoAppliedAdjustedLine: We adjusted your planned contributions in an amount that keeps you below the annual contribution limit.
messages.wtaEarnedIncomeQuestion: Does the beneficiary have earned income?
messages.wtaEligibleOverCombinedLine1: You qualify for additional contributions of {{additional}}, but your total contributions exceed the combined limit of {{combined}}.
messages.wtaEligibleOverCombinedLine2: Please revise your contribution amounts to bring total contributions below the combined limit.
messages.wtaNotEligible: You are not eligible for additional ABLE contributions under the ABLE to Work provision.
messages.wtaRetirementPlanQuestion: Is the beneficiary covered by a retirement plan?
messages.wtaSetToMaxNote: We'll reduce the recurring contribution to keep a rolling 12-month total within the limit.
messages.wtaSetToMaxQuestion: Would you like to set contributions to the maximum allowed amount?

defaultMessages: This is where the ABLE planner shares updates, alerts, and guidance based on your inputs and may ask for additional information.
Please use the input fields to provide the requested information for the ABLE planner.
Use the information icons next to each input for field-specific guidance.
This is where the ABLE planner shares updates, alerts, and guidance based on your inputs and may ask for additional information.
Please use the Account Activity input fields to define your planning assumptions.

home.heading: Welcome
home.intro: This is the clean foundation for the ABLE Planner. UI, copy, and logic will be layered in gradually.

landing.disclosuresBody:
This tool is for informational and educational purposes only
This ABLE planning tool is provided solely for general informational and educational purposes. It is not intended to provide legal, tax, investment, or financial advice, and should not be relied upon as a substitute for advice from qualified professionals.

No guarantee of results
All projections, charts, and reports generated by this tool are hypothetical and based on user-provided assumptions. Actual results may differ materially. There is no guarantee that projected balances, investment returns, contribution eligibility, or tax benefits will be achieved.

You may lose some or all of the money invested in an ABLE account.

Investment risk
ABLE accounts are subject to market risk, including the possible loss of principal. Investment returns are not guaranteed, and past performance is not indicative of future results. Changes in market conditions, fees, expenses, and investment selections may significantly affect outcomes. Market volatility, sequence-of-returns risk, and intra-year return variation are not simulated.

Assumptions and simplifications
This tool relies on simplifying assumptions, which may include constant or estimated rates of return, regular contribution and withdrawal schedules, and simplified treatment of taxes and tax benefits. Actual ABLE program rules, investment performance, and tax treatment vary by state and may change over time.

Contribution limits and eligibility
Annual contribution limits, ABLE to Work eligibility, federal benefits, state benefits, and tax treatment are governed by federal and state law and individual ABLE program rules. This tool does not determine eligibility or compliance and should not be used to make final contribution or withdrawal decisions.

Withdrawals and qualified expenses
Withdrawals from an ABLE account must generally be used for qualified disability expenses to avoid adverse tax consequences. This tool does not evaluate whether planned withdrawals qualify under applicable rules.

Not an offer or recommendation
Nothing contained in this tool constitutes an offer to sell, a solicitation of an offer to buy, or a recommendation regarding any investment, security, or financial product.

Use at your own discretion
By using this tool, you acknowledge that you are solely responsible for how you interpret and use the information provided. For guidance specific to your situation, consider consulting a qualified financial, tax, or legal professional, or your state’s ABLE program administrator.
landing.disclosuresIntro: Please read the following important disclosures and limitations before using this tool.
landing.heroBody:
An ABLE account can be a powerful tool for saving, investing, and paying for qualified disability-related expenses—without jeopardizing critical public benefits.

This planning tool helps you explore different scenarios, compare outcomes, and better understand how today’s decisions may affect future balances.

Use this tool to:
heroBullets: Explore long-term ABLE account growth under different assumptions
Understand how contribution limits and eligibility rules may apply
Review projected balances, summaries, and charts across time
landing.heroSubtitle: Explore how contributions, withdrawals, investment growth, and program limits may interact over time.
landing.termsOfUseBody:
These Terms of Use ("Terms") govern your access to and use of the ABLE Planning Tool (the "Tool") provided by Spectra Professional Services, LLC. ("Company," "we," "us," or "our"). By accessing or using the Tool, you agree to be bound by these Terms. If you do not agree, you should not use the Tool.

1. Informational and Educational Purposes Only
This Tool is provided solely for general informational and educational purposes. It is not intended to provide legal, tax, investment, or financial advice, and should not be relied upon as a substitute for advice from qualified professionals.

2. No Guarantee of Results
All projections, charts, and reports generated by this Tool are hypothetical and based on user-provided assumptions. Actual results may differ materially. There is no guarantee that projected balances, investment returns, contribution eligibility, or tax benefits will be achieved.

3. Risk of Loss
You may lose some or all of the money invested in an ABLE account.

4. Investment Risk
ABLE accounts are subject to market risk, including the possible loss of principal. Investment returns are not guaranteed, and past performance is not indicative of future results. Changes in market conditions, fees, expenses, and investment selections may significantly affect outcomes. Market volatility, sequence-of-returns risk, and intra-year return variation are not simulated.

5. Assumptions and Simplifications
This Tool relies on simplifying assumptions, including estimated rates of return, regular contribution and withdrawal schedules, and simplified treatment of taxes and tax benefits. Actual ABLE program rules, investment performance, and tax treatment vary by state and may change over time.

6. Contribution Limits and Eligibility
Contribution limits, eligibility rules, federal and state benefits, and tax treatment are governed by federal and state law and individual ABLE program rules. This Tool does not determine eligibility or compliance and should not be used to make final contribution or withdrawal decisions.

7. Withdrawals and Qualified Expenses
Withdrawals must generally be used for qualified disability expenses to avoid adverse tax consequences. This Tool does not evaluate whether planned withdrawals qualify under applicable rules.

8. Not an Offer or Recommendation
Nothing contained in this Tool constitutes an offer to sell, a solicitation of an offer to buy, or a recommendation regarding any investment, security, or financial product.

9. Limitation of Liability
To the fullest extent permitted by law, Spectra Professional Services, LTD. shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages, or for any loss of profits, data, or goodwill arising out of or related to your use of the Tool. Total liability, if any, shall not exceed the amount paid by you, if any, for access to the Tool.

10. Indemnification
You agree to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Spectra Professional Services, LTD., its officers, directors, employees, and affiliates from and against any claims, liabilities, damages, losses, and expenses arising out of or related to your use of the Tool or violation of these Terms.

11. Governing Law
These Terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the applicable state and federal laws of the United States, without regard to conflict of law principles. Any disputes shall be resolved in a court of competent jurisdiction.

12. Use at Your Own Discretion
By using this Tool, you acknowledge that you are solely responsible for how you interpret and use the information provided. For guidance specific to your situation, you should consult a qualified financial, tax, or legal professional, or your state's ABLE program administrator.

13. Contact Information
If you have questions about these Terms, please contact Spectra Professional Services, LLC. at: ableplannertool@spectraps.com

Electronic Acceptance
By clicking the button labeled "Agree and Continue" you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be legally bound by these Terms of Use. If you do not agree to these Terms, you must not click the button and may not use the Tool.

Your electronic acceptance of these Terms constitutes a legally binding agreement equivalent to a handwritten signature.
